text: The atmosphere is drab and the smell of old age lingers. ZAK (22), a young man with high-functioning Down syndrome sits in the lunchroom pushing food around on his plate. He shares a glance with ROSEMARY (92), who sits across th table. She looks down at a piece of paper in her hands, f it, places it in her pocket, and nods at Zak. Zak nods back and slowly pushes his pudding across the ta Rosemary eats the pudding, enjoying every bite. Zak looks around and sees senior citizens moving slowly. Wheelchairs and walkers surround him. ELEANOR (26), a kind brunette with understated beauty is dressed in business casual. She helps CARL (82) into his chair. Carl is gray all over and carries a cane; he flirt with the confidence of a man in his prime.
I like the cut of your jib darling.
Thanks Carl.

Can I have those earrings? If I give them to Rosemary I think she might finally let me see what’s under that muumuu. Carl is pleased with his joke. Eleanor shakes her head an smiles. Eleanor moves around the room with the grace of a Kennedy she passes by Zak and Rosemary’s table. She adores Zak an love is palpable in her demeanor.
That’s sweet that you gave Rosemary your pudding Zak.
I'm just trying to be a really nice guy.  2. Zak follows Eleanor with his eyes as she exits the room a then looks to the exit sign above a door.
(whispers) Now. Rosemary places her hand on her heart and starts breathin loudly as nurses come rushing to her aid.

The door flings open and Zak comes sprinting out! He is followed by Eleanor and two male nurses dressed in white. Zak moves fast but awkwardly across the lawn; he stumbles over his own feet but keeps going. A smile creeps across face. BOOM! He is violently blindsided by another nurse. He nev saw the tackle coming.

TYLER (33), an adult Huckleberry Finn, wears a rubber apr made for fishing, a dirty white T-shirt, and a tattered r hat. He drives a crab boat through the Colington Harbor. He passes large commercial fishing boats, rusty cranes, a weathered fish packing houses.

Tyler pulls up crab traps with Carolina blue buoys and sh his catch into large wooden boxes. Taped above his steering column is a sun-bleached photo o him and his big brother, MARK (38), standing next to an o pickup truck. Mark has his arm over Tyler’s shoulder. Tyler eyes a red buoy bobbing almost directly on top his one and checks the area to see if anyone is watching. With the coast clear he reaches down, flicks open a buck knife and cuts the line to the red one.

Tyler slows his boat upon seeing a North Carolina Fisheri Warden who has stopped to check another fisherman's catch Tyler then turns his boat and speeds away in the opposite direction. EXT. RETIREMENT HOME - ZAK & CARL’S ROOM - DAY The two male nurses screw small gauge aluminum bars onto Zak's window then shake them to make sure they are attach securely. INT. RETIREMENT HOME - ZAK & CARL’S ROOM - DAY Zak, still with remnants of dirt on his face, inspects an VHS tape carefully. He lifts the cover flap, and blows on magnetic strip. Zak places the tape into the player; it is labeled: “THE WATER REDNECK.” Sitting at attention on the edge of his bed, Zak watches footage of his favorite wrestler. THE SALT WATER REDNECK(34) wears blue camouflage briefs a matching face paint. His hair is long, luscious, blonde, held back by a rolled bandana that matches his briefs. Carl sits close by, with an afghan blanket draped over hi

Lord knows if I had a nickel for every time you watched that video tape I would be a rich man. The video has high production value from the ‘80s, comple with star wipes and laser noises. Fans cheer as The Redneck roars like a lion and flexes in slow motion. The camera is close up on his sweaty face as he throws a grown man from the ring and a title flashes on the screen “ATOMIC THROW!” Zak opens and closes his hands in excitement.
Some people claim the move is impossible.
I challenge those people to define what possible is? I believe in myself. I know I’m the best, that’s why I’m the only wrestler that can do it. Simple as that. Zak looks pleased.
We have watched that throw ten times today already.
I love The Salt Water Redneck. He is my hero, and he is a badass, and he is the greatest person ever.
And you will be the next badass!
(Directly to camera) Come to my wrestling school and you can learn the skills that it takes to be like The Salt Water Redneck!

(To Carl) I want to have the skills. Carl nods. On screen The Salt Water Redneck does a flip from the top rope and lands elbow first into the chest of his opponent Eleanor enters heated, carrying a clipboard. She turns the TV off and sits, balancing frustration and in her demeanor. Although her words seem cutting they are delivered tenderly. She loves Zak wholeheartedly.
You and Rosemary both lost all your privileges for the week.
Move Rosemary in here and I'1l keep an eye on both of them. Carl winks at Zak.
This isn't a joke Zak, I'm labeling you a flight risk. Eleanor makes a note on her clipboard.

That’s twice now, two times. And you're getting other people in trouble with you. (beat) It's my job to keep you safe and you’re making my job hard. Eleanor holds up a drawing in front of Zak. It’s an energ and colorful self-portrait that depicts Zak with rippling muscles busting through a brick wall like the Kool-Aid ma On the bottom it says, “pudding?”
Is this what you gave to Rosemary to convince her to fake choking?
Yes it is.
It's really creative.
Not just creative, it’s genius! You know why? That’s an advertisement for what he wants to do with the rest of his LIFE!
(easing a bit) You're a dreamer Zak, and I admire that, but the reality is--
--Eleanor, I am young and I am not old. Carl is old and we are different. Carl reacts to the jab from Zak about his age.
I wish I had a better option for you Zack. You don’t have a family that can that can provide adequate supervision. (MORE )
The state has to put you somewhere and this is that place right now. Zak deflates.
(to Zak) You been here two years?
Two and a half years.
We gotta fix that.
Eleanor, did you get me that soap I asked for? Eleanor hands Carl a container of liquid soap.

(To Zak) Stay on your best behavior for the next week, and you can get your special request privilege back too. Zak sticks his tongue out playfully at Eleanor and she do the same back. INT. WINKIE’S FISH HOUSE - DAY Tyler guts and cleans fish. A knife powerfully enters the fish’s soft fleshy underbel Blood and scales fly. He is working hard while listening to music coming from a crank radio. WINKIE (64), a kind-faced family man enters. He is sturdy from a life spent fishing crab pots and pulling nets, yet soft around the eyes and quick to smile.
Tyler. Tyler is listening to music and doesn't hear.
Tyler! Tyler turns down the music on the crank radio.
Hey bud, Duncan and Ratboy are looking for you, you know what that’s about? Tyler goes back to cleaning. He tears the spine out of th red drum (a meaty game fish found in the Atlantic).
I could speculate a guess.
Them boys are pit bulls, don’t mess with them.
(to himself) Maybe they messed with me. Tyler is focused on the task at hand. His knife removes t head and tail of the fish with two confident chops. Winkie looks on, saddened by Tyler’s demeanor.
That’s it for the day, bud.
You said I could clean all the fish you were gonna send to market?
That’s it, that’s all of ‘em.
I need a job Winkie, I barely cleaned one bucket of drum. You gotta have some snapper or sheep’s head for me?

Not biting right now, bud. You better just go. EXT. BOAT DOCK OUTSIDE WINKIE’S FISH HOUSE - DAY Tyler solemnly sits on a railroad tie overlooking the mar  8. Winkie brings a peace offering of a cold beer and sits be him.
Thanks, Wink.

There’s only so many commercial tags to go around. You can’t help it that Dunc and Ratboy scooped up Mark’s as soon as he passed. (beat) I can’t have you bringing me fish caught without a license bud. I get caught and it’s my ass, not yours.
What am I supposed to do? I would have bought it if--
--Get your life together, get it in order. Mark would be proud of you if you did that. He’d be very proud of you if you did that. Winkie stands to walk away and leaves Tyler alone with hi thoughts.

Begin flashback music. Tyler and his big brother MARK scrub barnacles off the bo of their boat raised up in dry dock. Mark is fit and tan and his clothes are faded by years of exposure to sun and salt water. He is clearly the alpha o the two and smiles as he playfully sprays Tyler with a ho Conversation is had but words can not be heard. Mark cracks a beer, goes to his pickup truck and pulls ou wrapped gift that is shaped like a baseball bat. Mark hands the present to Tyler. Tyler looks at Mark with admiration and takes it. Tyler unwraps an older, used, but beautiful, shotgun. Mark ruffles Tyler’s hair as he looks the gun over.  9. Mark runs his fingers over the wood that is branded “Fami First.” Tyler smiles and thanks his brother. They hug with a lovi masculine embrace. End flashback music.

INT. RETIREMENT HOME - ZAK & CARL’S ROOM - NIGHT The lights are off and Zak sits on the edge of his bed on again watching his Salt Water Redneck VHS. Flickering light from the TV illuminates his face and highlights the edges of the bars freshly installed outsid his window. He is a prisoner now. One of the male nurses from earlier pokes his head throug the door.

Lights out, retard. The nurse flicks the lights off. INT. RETIREMENT HOME - ZAK & CARL’S ROOM - NIGHT Zak lies on his bed, staring at the ceiling. The clock re 3:21 AM. A hand reaches out to wake him, it’s Carl.
(whispering) Hey son, get up. I want to show you something.
Carl stands in front of the bars on the window. He tears pieces of bed sheet and wraps them around two of the bars
Did you know I was an engineer in another life? I was. Zak watches Carl, amazed. Carl places his cane between the strips of sheets. He beg to rotate the cane, reeling in the slack in the fabric.  10.
Here, you're strong, you do this. Zak takes his place. He spins the cane and the fabric pul harder on the bars.
Good, that’s it there. The bars slowly begin to bend together. Zak strains as he turns the cane another rotation.

Now move down and do it again. (beat) A bird in a cage ain’t really even a bird. God gave you a gift. It’s a shame people don’t know how to let an animal as beautiful as you fly. Zak continues his work and the gap between the bars grows Carl smiles and hands Zak the bottle of liquid soap that Eleanor gave him earlier. He holds Zak’s hands between hi Zak smiles and looks down at the gift.
Carl, you are my best friend, and you are my family.
Well that’s it. Friends are the family you choose.
And Carl, you are invited to my birthday party.
Thank you, I’m there. Carl kisses Zak gently on the forehead; they hug goodbye.

Now go kick some ass. Zak, takes his pajamas off. Carl slips into his bed and closes his eyes. The poster of the Salt Water Redneck that hangs above Zak bed looks down approvingly.  11. Zak stands only in his tighty-whities illuminated by moonlight. He looks at the compromised prison bars on his window, in on doing it right this time. He begins stretching like a weekend jogger. He touches hi toes and stretches his torso from side to side. He takes a few deep breaths, nostrils flare. He cracks his neck and hits his chest with a closed fist. He picks up the bottle of Carl’s liquid soap and squirts into his hands. Zak lathers up his stomach, his back, and arms. Finally, he puts it all over his face. He reaches out and grabs the bars... .+.-puts one leg through easily... .--his torso hits the bars and stops. Zak groans and forces his body through the opening. His face, still not through the gap, smashes together mak his lips purse. He breathes harder. His skin bunches up, glistening from the soap; as it give way, he slides through the bars. Zak grins, and takes off across the lawn. Carl smiles and waves goodbye from behind the bent bars. Zak is running across the lawn in slow motion. He glisten the moonlight. EXT. BOAT DOCK OUTSIDE WINKIE’S FISH HOUSE - MORNING Zak, still in his underwear from the night before, enters boat yard timidly. He hears a door open and dives behind a large stack of cr pots. Tyler exits the fish house, wearing cut off jean shorts a white T-shirt. Fish blood and scales cover his hands and torso. DUNCAN (49), a wiry fisherman with sure blue eyes and the strength of a man twice his size immediately shoves Tyler into the stack of crab pots that Zak is hiding behind.  12. Duncan’s hands are callused from honest work, and leave grease marks on Tyler’s shirt upon impact. RATBOY (27) and CRAIG (39) round out Duncan’s posse, they nearby on open tailgate of his camouflage diesel truck watching as the scene develops. Ratboy is rail thin, covered in tattoos, and looks sickly with graying teeth. Craig is unforgettably obese and laug with a high pitch chuckle that cuts above the noise.
You cut the buoys off my pots? Duncan grabs Tyler violently by the collar. Tyler’s fists by his side, ready to be used if needed.
You cut them buoys?!
We've been laying our pots on the Powell’s Point for years, Duncan.
Fuck him up, Dunc!
Powell’s Point WAS Mark’s, but Mark is gone. It was his fishing license too, remember?
You cain’t fish there no more!

Bring back so much as a minnow and I’ll have the Game Warden cart your ass to prison. You’re done crabbing in Colington. This ignites Tyler’s anger and the two start to fight. Zak crawls along the pots trying to get away from the mel Duncan, much better with his hands, hits Tyler with one powerful punch to the gut and drops him to the ground.
(to Tyler) There's 10 fishing licenses to go around Dare County.  13. Duncan pulls out a piece of paper from his pocket.
This one used to be Mark’s, but it says Duncan Silver now. (beat) That's just business. Ratboy gets off the truck and walks toward Tyler.
You owe me 40 pots. Duncan walks toward his truck and points to a large stack crab pots adorned with red buoys.

Touch my rigs again and you better grow eyes in the back of your head. I ain’t jokin’ either. I’1l bash your skull in with a tire iron. Ratboy drops down and puts his hand on Tyler’s throat who still laid out in the dirt.
(almost whispering) You cain’t fish, sure as shit cain’t fight, whatcha still doing in Colington? Ratboy hawks up a loogy and spits it on Tyler's face.

(as he walks away) That's right, someone gotta clean all those crabs we gonna be bringing in. Zak climbs down into Tyler’s boat and pulls a tarp over h head to hide. INT. RETIREMENT HOME - ZAK & CARL’S ROOM - DAY Eleanor, in a state of complete shock, looks at the compromised bars on Zak’s window. She breathes deep.
Shit. Carl is lying in bed watching; Eleanor turns to address h  14.
Well where did he go? Carl looks guilty and shrugs sheepishly.

You've got answers and you’re going to give them to me one way or another. JANICE, (42) a strong and vibrant African-American nurse middle management pops her head into the room. She wears hair in long braids featuring colorful beads that touch t small of her back.
E, Glen wants to see you in his office. (as she walks away) We are so fucked.
Thanks Janice.

Tyler sits in silence leaned against a wooden piling, dir and blood still on his face. From the pocket of his shorts he pulls out an old plastic filled with dirty cigarette butts and rolling papers. After placing a rolling paper on his lap he harvests toba from five cigarette butts; hand rolls, licks, and lights a match. As he smokes Tyler eyes Duncan and Ratboy’s crab pots wit their red buoys. He goes to his boat and fumbles around looking for someth He almost pulls the tarp off Zak, but at the last second, grabs a large red canister of gasoline. Tyler pours the gas all over Duncan & Ratboy’s buoys. He contemplates for a moment, then tosses his cigarette d immediately setting the gasoline soaked pile ablaze. His eyes widen as the fire starts to take over more than the buoys. Every crab pot Duncan owns is now on fire.  15. Tyler, nervous, gets in his boat, puts the key in the ignition and turns it. Nothing.

Shit. Tyler turns the key again, nothing. Men yell in the distance as the light from the fire flick and highlights the concern on Tyler’s face. Tyler turns the key again and the engine, a single 90 hor power Yamaha, spins but doesn’t start. Duncan and Ratboy approach fast. Tyler turns the engine again, it chokes and sputters. Once more he turns the key and it starts reluctantly. The running lights on the boat all come to life. Tyler punches hard on the throttle and spins the wheel ju as Ratboy and Duncan are getting out of their pickup. Duncan and Ratboy run toward their boat to chase.

INTERCUT BETWEEN DUNCAN’S BOAT & TYLER’S BOAT. Tyler is far out in front, but Duncan and Ratboy are gain ground. Duncan and Ratboy’s boat has two 200 horsepower motors, a they run clean and fast. Tyler takes a hard turn into a maze of tall marshy grass an attempt to lose the larger boat. Zak, still hidden under the tarp, is getting tossed aroun like a rag doll. Tyler weaves through the reeds like an old pro. He stops and throws the engine abruptly in reverse. He ba into a concealed spot in the grass barely wide enough for boat. Quickly, he shuts the engine off. The motor goes silent a the running lights go dark.  16. Tyler looks anxious but remains quiet. Ratboy and Duncan look around, they’ve lost Tyler in the reeds.

He's here somewhere. Zak, seasick from the chaos of the boat ride, starts to grumble. Tyler, startled by the sound, tears the tarp off the stowaway just as Zak starts to dry heave and then vom loudly. Ratboy tilts his head like a hunting dog.
Shhhh... Duncan shuts off his boat, and they sit in silence for a moments... They hear Zak’s vomiting.
There! Tyler, furious and scared, covers Zak's mouth but the retching isn’t finished. Vomit oozes above and below Tyle hand and between the fingers pressed hard against Zak's f
Who are you?! Zak pulls Tyler’s hand down from his mouth to speak.

I’m Zak. Duncan’s boat approaches. Tyler quickly and confidently starts the engine and gasse it, pulling his boat out 100 feet in front of Duncan's. Duncan and Ratboy gain on Tyler as they both hit open wat The lights on Tyler’s boat are becoming noticeably closer

You got nowhere to hide now. Tyler is driving fast, water slaps loudly at the hull. Ni is approaching. He looks over his shoulder, Duncan and Ratboy are getting closer.  17. Tyler tears his shirt off and uses it like a rope to affi the steering wheel to the compass so the boat doesn't tur He then grabs a hammer and smashes out the running lights by one.

Fucker. Tyler's lights disappear completely. Duncan slows his boat and stares into the darkness. INT. RETIREMENT HOME - GLEN’S OFFICE - NIGHT GLEN (57) sits across from Eleanor. He is small in statur oily, and balding. He has the look of an unkempt man and clicks his pen angrily over and over while looking at Eleanor’s clipboard. His office is filthy. He reads for a few moments, then flips a page over.
A flight risk? Eleanor nods her head yes.
Looks like all that family money of yours bought you a degree but didn't get you no common sense. Eleanor shifts nervously and subtly moves her hair to cov her diamond earrings.
I’m sorry, but my family history has nothing to do--
Don’t speak. Eleanor bites her tongue.
You let a half naked boy with Down syndrome who has no money, no family, and no idea how to get along in this world just slip out from under your nose into thin air. Eleanor remains silent.  18.
And you have no idea where he is, where he’s going or who he might be with?
Well I have--
--The nurses tell me you two are close.
We are.
Then you'll figure out where he’s at and bring him back before I have to report this to the state.
No Glen, you have to report this, he’s missing.
Find him.

Tyler's boat is beached a few feet away from where he sit the sand with Zak, the two silently study each other. Zak is still in his tighty-whities and looks filthy. Tyler is still covered in dirt and blood.
Why were you on my boat? Zak does not answer. Tyler continues to stare.
Cat got your tongue? Zak still does not answer.
You running from something? Zak stirs a little at this comment.  19.
You got something to hide? Zak looks uncomfortable.

That’s it, isn't it? (beat) Well, that’s your business. EXT. TYLER’S BOAT BEACHED ON THE SAND ISLAND - DAY Tyler turns the engine, it screeches and whines, metal bi metal. Smoke plumes from the vents. The pistons have seiz Tyler, a true water cowboy, isn’t fazed. On to the next. He moves fast and starts throwing things from the boat on the beach. A backpack, some fishing line, duct tape, an o pair of white rubber fishing boots, his crank radio, an e pair of clothes, some prepackaged food you might find at gas station, a long cord of rope, and a canteen. These things land close to Zak, almost hitting him. Tyler pauses a moment to look at the photo of Mark and carefully puts it in his pocket. He grabs a 12 gauge shot and a box of shells. Zak looks worried. Tyler loads the gun and unleashes three blasts into the floorboards of the boat. Zak flinches and covers his ears. The boat begins to sink. Tyler begins to pack up his gear.
You got thirty minutes till the tide comes up and this whole place is under water. He walks past Zack along the sand bar. Zak follows, fumbling to catch up, tripping over his feet
Umm... Why did you do that?  20.
Covering my tracks.
Oh, OK. (beat) Ummm... Where are we? Tyler doesn’t answer.
(beat) See... Um... I don’t know where I am, so I don’t know how to get where I’m going.
Tyler reaches the shallows and starts to wade through the knee-high water. Zak stops timidly at the water’s edge an looks out at Tyler who is still moving.
Oh no. (to Tyler) Umm... Excuse me... Excuse me? Tyler turns and looks at Zak.
Yeah, umm... See, umm... I can’t swim. Will you please help me? Will you please be my friend? Tyler watches. Zak slowly begins wading through the water toward Tyler.
(upon reaching Tyler) OK, I’m OK now. Zak gives Tyler a thumbs up.
You following me? Zak shrugs and sighs, then nods his head yeah.
Do you know where Manteo is? Zak shakes his head no.  21.
Do you have any clean water? Zak shakes his head no.
Can you fend for yourself at all? Zak looks ashamed. Tyler hands Zak a canteen of water, Zak chugs it, then ha it back. Tyler starts to walk away and Zak follows.
When I can leave you, I will.
Tyler walks in front of Zak, who hangs on his heels like puppy -

.-.and then The Salt Water Redneck throws people, it’s called the “Atomic Throw”! Zak mimics the Salt Water Redneck’s signature move as he out a feeble attempt at a roar. Tyler continues walking; he doesn’t engage in the conversation.
I’m going to Ayden, North Carolina to learn the moves... (beat) Zak pumps his arms in the air and makes a cheering noise.
And they might say, “Zak you are so awesome. You are a bird. You are the most free bird ever.” Zak squeezes his hands excitedly.
Oh yeah! Tyler stops and faces Zak, which abruptly shuts him up.  22.
You're walking real close to me. Zak takes two small steps backwards. He looks at Tyler as to say “OK, is this enough?” The two start walking again. It is quiet for just a moment.
And I am going to live in a big house with lots of snacks and drinks and I’'1l have an airplane--
--Does your family know where you are?

My friends know where I am. Tyler takes out a granola bar from his backpack and takes big bite. Zak watches, almost drooling. Tyler glances over his shoulder and notices Zak watching but keeps eating. Zak's pale skin is turning pink from the sun.

(mouth full) Not worried about a sunburn, huh? INT. RETIREMENT HOME - ZAK & CARL’S ROOM - DUSK Eleanor watches Zak’s wrestling VHS intently, putting together clues and connecting the dots. The “ATOMIC THROW” title card flashes.

If you come to my wrestling school in Ayden North Carolina I will teach you the skills... Eleanor writes “Ayden” with permanent marker on the palm her hand. Her face shows worry about where Zak might be, how she ca find him, and if he’s safe.  23.

Children are playing at a redneck water park. The structu is a huge mess of scrap wood rising sixty feet above the water. It has a handmade Water World vibe. A boy of 14 does a back flip from the top platform.
End of the road. Zak watches another boy do a gainer off the top.
You know my name?
No.
Good. You never saw me, OK?
Hey... Can I come with you?
Why would I need you to come with me?
Maybe we could be friends, buddies, roll dogs? And hang, and chill, and have a good time.
(over his shoulder) Don’t go getting yourself killed. A brief but warm moment is shared here. Zak waves as Tyle walks away. Zak walks toward the group of boys on the dock.
Do you guys like birthday parties?

Tyler walks alone beside a cornfield and picks a cigarett butt off the ground.  24. He hears the sound of an engine approaching and puts his thumb out. A truck pulls over just in front of him and Tyler picks u his pace to get in.

Tyler rides along side of a TRUCKER (54) in an older mode Chevy pickup truck. There is a happy, beat-up, mangy, one eyed dog sitting in between them. The two men sit in silence for a while. The mangy dog pants comically close to Tyler's face.
He a good dog?
She’s good enough. (beat) She don’t run away, so I guess that makes her mine. Wife’s long gone, and my kids are grown. (beat) We look out for each other.
What’s her name?
She ain’t got one. I just... The trucker whistles three short notes. TRUCKER (CONT’D) ...and say, “Come here dog!” And, she comes.
Seems like a good dog.
She’s good enough. The trucker rubs the dog’s head. TRUCKER (CONT’D) Crazy ain't it? That fire down at the docks? Tyler takes notice but tries to hide his concern.  25.
I didn’t hear much about it. (beat) What are people saying?

Started off small, got out of hand pretty fast. (beat) Some of them boys are out right now looking for the guy that lit it. They set up a road block on 158. Tyler soaks this in. Red lights flash below the railroad crossing sign ahead a the gate lowers. The truck comes to a stop. Tyler plots his next move as the train passes by. After a moment he opens the door and exits the truck. TRUCKER (CONT’D) Sure you don’t want a ride all the way into town? I’m going right there. The dog licks toward Tyler’s face through the window.
(beat) Nah, I left something back there. Tyler watches the truck drive away. He then turns and duc into the cornfield.

Tyler walks toward the docks where the boys were playing earlier; he hears taunting. Zak has climbed up to the tallest platform and the older are causing a scene. A FAT BULLY (12) stands next to Zak on the platform fifty feet above the water.
Jump retard. Jump! Zak peers over the edge.  26. FAT BULLY (CONT’D) Durr durr durr! I thought you were a retard not a pussy! Jump, you retard!
(yelling up the bully) Hey, he can’t swim.
(to Tyler) Like I care dipshit. Tyler drops his backpack and climbs up the platform hand- hand. FAT BULLY (CONT’D) Do it! Jump!
I said he can’t swim.

I am not going to do it. The bully pushes Zak off the platform. His body hits the water hard and immediately sinks. Tyler makes it to the top and walks to the edge of the platform. He stares down waiting for Zak to reappear. Only bubbles rise to the surface.
Shit man, that dummy sank like a rock.
(to himself) Come on... Tyler starts taking his shirt off.
What’s that, 20 feet deep??
Twenty five at least.
How strong’s that current?  27.

Running ‘bout four knots south. Tyler takes that in and cracks his knuckles. FAT BULLY (CONT’D) Hey... you’re the guy that cleans fish over at-- Tyler punches the boy in the face, then jumps in after Za Beneath the surface Tyler swims downward into the darknes the murky water, wraps his right arm around Zak’s limp bo and begins his ascent toward the light.
Zak coughs up water as Tyler sits next to him soaking wet
So there’s a wrestling school in Ayden?
Yeah.
And they teach you full-on, legit, WWF moves?
What does legit mean? Tyler takes out a map from his bag and unfolds it on the beach so Zak can see; he tracks his finger with his words

We’re in Manteo, right here. (beat) And this is Ayden, 70 miles from here. That’s where the wrestling school is you're talking about. See that, it’s on my way. The map shows Ayden at the end of a long narrow barrier island with only one road running its entire length. (beat) And then this is Florida. (beat) That’s where I’m going, Ayden is on my way.  28. Tyler puts the map in his bag.
You bullshitting me about this wrestling school? You swear to god? Zak holds up his right hand as if he is testifying in cou
Yes, I swear to god. I have proof of the video tape.

Alright, I’1l drop you there then. I ain’t doing no charity shit, it’s just on my way. Tyler pulls an old greasy black Grave Digger monster truc shirt from his backpack and throws Zak. Zak stands and puts it on.
What is your name? Tyler turns to face Zak.
Tyler.
That is a very cool name.
Eleanor shows people the photo of Zak and asks if anyone seen him. They shake their heads “no.”
Eleanor knocks on a series of doors searching for Zak.
A SUBURBAN HOUSEWIFE (52) stands at her door.
He’s young, what’s he doing in an old persons home?  29.
It’s pretty common for people with disabilities like Zak to be placed in a nursing home, no matter what their age is.
That seems odd.
Yeah, I guess it is a little odd isn’t it? (beat) If you see him can you give me a call? Eleanor passes a piece of paper with her phone number thr the crack in the door.
Thank you.
Duncan leans against his truck and watches Ratboy in the distance slapping the Fat Bully in the face.
Which way did he go?
I told you I don’t know!
Tyler and Zak walk hidden from the road through cornfield Tyler leads. Zak gets hit in the face by leaves as they move.
My Feet hurt. (beat) Tyler, do you have a car? Tyler does not answer.
Tyler, can we please walk on the road?  30. Tyler, frustrated, turns to face Zak.
Excuse me... Will you please answer me?

When I was a kid, my brother and I were camping off of Caffey’s inlet, and there was this big ol’ hornet’s nest right by the water. I just strolled over to it and boom, hit it with a stick like a baseball bat, home run. I got stung bad and my eyes swole shut. Mark was pissed. He said, “Keep stirring up shit, get yourself killed.” (beat) A little older. Little wiser. Not much. I’m still whacking hornet’s nests. (beat) You ever kick a hornet’s nest?
Yeah, last night. Tyler is surprised by Zak's answer.
You hit a hornet’s nest last night?
Last night.

Well, then you understand why I can’t walk on that road right now. Stop with this “Tyler” shit, we're gonna be quiet the rest of the way. Tyler turns around again and leads Zak through the corn. Silence and walking.
Tyler... Tyler's frustration boils over; he turns to face Zak agai
Finish what you got to say and then we’re gonna walk on in silence. Tyler! Tyler! Tyler! Tyler, What?!  31. Zak's tone turns serious.
I want you to know about me. (beat) I am a Down syndrome person. Tyler takes this in.
I don’t really give a shit. You got supplies?
No. The two set off again through the corn.
We’re gonna need some supplies.

location: CORNFIELD ACROSS FROM THE CONVENIENCE STORE

text: Zak and Tyler, peer through cornstalks at a dilapidated country store / gas station surrounded by farm land.
How much money you got?
Oh, I got no money, and I got no pockets. Zak still wears tighty-whities and the shirt Tyler gave h Tyler gives Zak a pair of camo pants from his bag.
I’m gonna go and grab some essentials.
Can I come?
No.

A brass bell above the door rings.  32. The CASHIER (77), an old, gray and frail man wearing Coke bottle glasses, watches Tyler enter. Tyler has his backpack on with the shotgun slung over his shoulder and dried blood on his shirt. The Cashier looks on nervously from behind the register. Tyler walks around the store filling up a basket with pea butter, fish hooks, fruit by the foot, Ding Dongs, a pre- sandwich, and Spam.
The Cashier slowly adds up the items by hand with a penci He is the embodiment of a turtle and speaks with a cadenc match.
That’1l be thirteen dollars, and eighty-three cents.
What?
Son, that sandwich alone is four dollars and your Ding Dongs they're two dollars a piece... and that’s another dollar thirty five-- Tyler separates the fruit snacks and the Ding Dongs.
--How much for just that?
Three dollars and we’ll call it even.
That'll work, just the peanut butter and the fish hooks.
Son, forgive me if I seem alarmed but I don’t normally negotiate on my prices with fellas that have shotguns laid across their backs. Tyler removes his backpack and shotgun to ease the tensio  33.
Thank ya kindly.
You got any airplane bottles of whiskey back there for two dollars?
No... but I got this. The cashier grabs a large unlabeled dirty jug of liquor f under the counter.
I can’t afford that.

This bottle’s on me, son. Looks like you might need it more than I do. I’1l just have me a splash to calm my nerves. The cashier’s hands are shaking as he takes a swig. He hands it to Tyler who does the same. The bell above the door sounds again and Eleanor enters. Both men take notice.
Ma’‘am.
Ma’‘am.
Gentlemen. Eleanor picks up a bag of M&M’s and approaches the counte
Missy, I'll have to ask you to forgive my elongated stare. I haven’t seen a woman as pretty as you since I cain’t remember when.
(to Eleanor) Where did you blow in here from? She sizes him up before answering.  34.
Richmond.
You graduate JMU or GW?
Yeah, you've got that kind of look about you.
What kind of look is that?
You know, just an excited to be alive kind of look. What you doing down here?
You're quite nosy.
I like to think I’m inquisitive with a side on interested.
Interested huh?
Yeah... you interested? Tyler lifts the bottle to offer her a drink.
I told you, I’m working.
You work crab boats? Tyler begins laughing at his own joke.
No.
See it’s funny because you don’t look like you would work on--
I know why you think it’s funny.  35.
Oh, you’re trouble. Eleanor pulls a photo of Zak out from her purse and holds up for the cashier to see.

I'm looking for a missing person. Have either of you gentlemen-- (to Tyler) --assuming I can use the word gentleman-- (to both of them) --have you seen him? The cashier takes the photo and looks closely.
No, I’m afraid I ain’t seen him. Eleanor holds the photo directly in front of Tyler.
Have you seen him? Tyler's eyes dart from the photo to Eleanor and back agai
What did he do?
He ran away from the nursing home where I work at; why, have you seen him?.
Is there a reward?
No.
You a bounty hunter?
Would I be a bounty hunter if I just said there’s no bounty?
Did he kill someone?
What are you then, his sister?
Not that’s it’s any of your business, but I care about him and he’s alone-- Eleanor gathers her things to leave.
--Maybe.
Maybe what?

Maybe he’s alone, or maybe he ain’t alone, you don’t know. Tyler picks up his backpack. What if he’s on a wild adventure and he joined up with a bunch of hitchhikers like something out of a Mark Twain novel? (beat) You like Mark Twain? Eleanor looks Tyler up and down, gun on his back, covered dirt and blood, and begins walking toward the door.
Can I have your phone number?
No. You cannot have my phone number.
OK, well what if I see your friend there, should I just yell out real loud for you then?
Yeah, just do that.
What name do you want me to yell?
Eleanor.  37. Tyler takes another swig from the jug and holds it up for Eleanor in a “cheers” motion.
Tyler struts out, smile still on his face and passes a wh van labeled “Britthaven Retirement”. He waves to Eleanor and she waves back.
Tyler pushes through the corn to where Zak is waiting.
You're a goddamn criminal ain’t ya? Little fugitive... man on the lam. Tyler walks fast as Zak tries to keep pace.
I met your girlfriend Eleanor in there, the cute one from the old folks’ home. She likes you quite a bit got a picture of you and everything. Showing everybody. Zak looks nervous.

That’s a good thing as far as I’m concerned. (beat) If we’re gonna make it 70 miles down river we need to have a tie that binds. The fact we are both wanted men is just the kind of tie we needed. Two bandits on the run!
Oh yeah! OK!

You do right by me, and I'll do right by you. I said I'll get you to The Salt Water Redneck’s place and I plan to deliver on my word. I’ve been called a lot of bad things in my life, but a liar isn’t one of them. They step out onto a dirt road.  38.
I’ve got two rules though.
One, don’t slow me down.
OK, and the other rule? Tyler stops to look at Zak.
I'm in charge. I say “jump” you say “how high?”
Got it!
Jump. Zak jumps awkwardly a few inches off the ground.
No. So I say “jump” and then you... Zak jumps again.
Just... I’m in charge. You got it? Zak nods, reaches his hand out, and Tyler shakes it. Tyler slips his backpack off and hands it to Zak.
You carry your own weight.
Uhhh... Tyler maybe we should have our own secret handshake.
What kind of secret handshake? For what?
Buds... dudes... Friends. Zak starts making the motions of a unique high five.  39.
Woo hoo ha ha yeah! And then I could spin like this. Zak lifts Tyler's hand up, hits it and spins around wavin his hand like a fish tail. Tyler starts walking again.
OK, but you can’t be doing that all the time. Only when special shit happens.
Deal. You are in charge.

location: BEACH AT THE END OF THE ROAD

text: Tyler and Zak approach the water’s edge where the road en Zak looks nervous.
It is too far to the other side.
Yeah, we ain’t got many options. We can’t spend two days scraping through briar bushes and we can’t go back the way we came so we’re gonna swim it. You got any better ideas?
We could get a plane and then--
--Take your pants off.
I can’t swim.

I know you can’t swim but you can float. Tyler takes the pair of pants and ties knots in the knees creates a crude floatation device for Zak. Tyler ties one end of his rope to Zak, feeds 30 feet thro his hands and ties the other end to himself.  40.

That water is almost 25 feet deep. Those pants should hold air just fine, but on the off chance you sink again I don’t want to go down with you, and I sure as hell don’t want to dredge for your body. (beat) This way I can pull you across without being scared of you drowning me. Tyler begins to put the backpack in a large trash bag to protect it from the water.
Do you think I could die?

Oh, you’re gonna die. Just a matter of time. (beat) The real question isn’t whether you'll die or not, it’s will you die with a bunch of good stories for people to tell about you when you're gone, now don’t be a bitch let’s go. Zak swallows hard.
Tyler swims out first while Zak waits on the shore, he ge out 25 feet and then yells to Zak.

Zak timidly gets in the water and starts gently kicking. Tyler is pulling him while swimming breast stroke. Zak looks like he might sink at any moment if he lost the pants filled with air. This goes on for some time. Tyler's view is slightly blocked by the waves and water. He hears the low deep rumble of an engine. Tyler pops his head up and sees a barge 250 meters away barreling toward them.  41.

Zak begins kicking his legs faster but isn’t making much progress. He submerges in the water and resurfaces. Tyler attempts to swim in full sprint but Zak is dead wei Tyler clears the path of the barge but it continues to be down toward Zak.
Zak begins to kick a bit harder but still moves slowly. Tyler hits the shore and starts pulling the rope as fast he can, hand-over-hand.

Zak kicks while Tyler frantically muscles in the rope whi falling backward, he is red and looks like he is going to pass out from exhaustion. The boat barely misses Zak. Tyler falls back onto the ground as Zak, now safe, kicks shore. Tyler breathes hard and looks spent. Zak walks up to him, grabs his hand, and pulls him to his feet fast and hard, demonstrating his great strength. Zak does the secret spinning handshake.
That is a good story we can tell. Zak starts to walk away but then turns to address Tyler.
You coming?

Tyler walks, lost in thought, not nearly as fast as befor After a moment he stops and looks behind him. He sees Zak, who has stopped to watch ants marching in a line. They carry loads ten times their size.  42.
Hey little ants. Hey there. Zak waves and smiles at the ants. Tyler softens.
Zak and Tyler sit on a log at the water's edge. Tyler enters the water and washes off the mud from earlie He motions for Zak to join and begins teaching him to swi
Tyler sits in the sand with his back leaned against a shipwrecked sailboat lit by the moon. Zak lays a few feet away splayed out in the sand. Tyler hand rolls a cigarette.
Zak lets out an evil cackle that sounds like a cartoon Dracula. He looks to Tyler for approval, who shakes his h “no.”
I ain’t even the slightest bit scared of you.
When I’m a professional wrestler I’m going to be a bad guy.
Why do you want to be the bad guy? Zak searches for the words.
Because my family left me. This hits Tyler hard.  43.

That don’t make you the bad guy. Good guys get left too Zak. It’s not about an evil laugh or wearing black. It has nothing to do with that; it has to do with what’s in here. Tyler taps his chest with his finger.
You got a good guy heart. You can’t do shit about it, that’s just who you are... You’re a hero. Zak thinks on this.
No, I can’t be a hero because I am a Down syndrome.
What’s that got to do with your heart? Who told you that?
Coach, teachers...
What’d your coach say?
He said I am retarded.
Sounds like a shitty coach. Your team ever win anything? Zak looks to Tyler and shrugs.
There’s lots of stuff you probably won't do. Like slam dunk a basketball or be an Olympic swimmer. (beat) You sink like a stone, know why? Zak shakes his head no.
Because you’re all muscle, and muscle sinks. (beat) (MORE )
Today when you pulled me up by the river... the most grown-ass men I know aren’t that strong. You almost took my arm off. Zak smiles.
Fuck your coach. Tyler lights the hand rolled cigarette. A warm glow illuminates his eyes.
Tyler, who were the people that chased us in the boat?
Duncan and Ratboy.
Are they good guys or bad guys?
Bad guys.
Tyler?
Yeah?
Are you a good guy or a bad guy? Long silence.
I don’t know, what you think?
You are a good guy.
Zak lies quietly and twitches in his sleep.

Begin flashback music.  45. Tyler and Mark sit at a bar surrounded by empty beer bott and shot glasses. Mark wears a cowboy hat and a crisp new purple brush popper (western shirt). Mark smiles at Tyler. They talk and connect but no words can be heard. Mark places his hand on the back of Tyler’s neck intimate

Tyler and Mark get in Mark’s pickup. Tyler is driving. The truck eats up miles on the dark and lonely road. Inside, Mark sleeps while Tyler's eyes get heavy. The truck crosses over the center line, continues off the road... End flashback music.
Tyler wakes to find Zak doing push-ups. Zak is grunting and straining to keep form. Tyler sits up, still sleepy.
Will you please train me?
What?
Train to be a hero.
You want me to train you?
Yeah.
I had big plans for today. I’m not sure I’1ll have time for that.  46. Zak stares at him waiting for the “yes.”
I... Uh... Sure... I guess, sure. (beat) You know I don’t know shit about wrestling. Zak shakes his head yes.
Ok. I'll just like... life train you.

--Zak does push-ups and sit-ups and shoulder presses a la branch. --Tyler throws dry crackers into the water, fish start to at them and Tyler blasts shotgun rounds into the school. --Tyler and Zak eat their catch off of sticks over a fire --They walk the train tracks while Zak bobs and weaves. --Tyler and Zak sit under a tree eating watermelon.
.--Eleanor, huh? Zak nods.
What’s she like?
She's my friend. She looks out for me. She gives me snacks, and she’s really sweet.
Not so sweet that you wanted to stick around.
No, not that sweet. --Tyler carves helmets out of the watermelon rind. --They play wrestle in a field. --Tyler puts four beer bottles on sticks 30 yards from wh Zak stands holding the shotgun.  47.
Just point and pull the trigger.
Yeah, got it.
Open your stance up a bit. --Zak opens his legs wider.
Good, now you look like an athlete. --Zak takes aim and shoots, all the bottles explode into glass shards. --Zak cheers and Tyler smiles.
I hit all of them!
It’s called buckshot. They do their secret handshake.
INT. ELEANOR’S CAR - DUSK Eleanor looks at a road map with a highlighted line that in Ayden. She marks an X directly on the line where the convenience store was located.
Tyler picks up a beer bottle.

Just keep your eye on the prize. Aim, and pull the trigger. Zak changes his foot position while Tyler isn't looking a places one foot directly next to the other one. Tyler throws the bottle in the air. Zak tracks the bottle through the air, pulls the trigger, hits his target. The kick sends him flying backwards.  48. Tyler runs to see if Zak is OK. Zak stands up, hobbles, and winces in pain.
You alright bud?

Tyler and Zak slide under a barbed-wire fence and stand a old ovens, broken-down cars, and metal barrels. Zak walks with difficulty, keeping weight off his ankle. Tyler quietly approaches an old 12 foot tin boat and star to pull scrap wood off of it.
This should work just fine. Zak looks nervous but starts to help Tyler. The distinct sound of a pistol cocks.

Tyler and Zak spin around to see BLIND JASPER JOHN (74), African American man, who has a six-shooter pointed direc at them. His head swivels back and forth like Stevie Wond His eyes have no pigment. They put their hands in the air.

One gat damn move from either of y'all and I will lay yo asses down. Ya'll trifling muh fuckas think cause ol’ Jasper is blind that you can come robbin’ his ass? Think again! Tyler and Zak are silent.
Y'all boys black or white? Tyler and Zak look at each other not knowing how to respo
OK then. Blind Jasper John blasts a slug past their heads!
Tyler and Zak fall to the ground.
Jesus! Wuh wuh wuh, we are white!
I knowd y’all was white! I could smell y’all from a mile away! (beat) Y'all God fearing? Tyler and Zak think for a moment.
Does it matter?
(Cocks pistol) Matters to me.
Then yes, we are. Blind Jasper John lowers his gun.
(Sweetens) A friend of Jesus is a friend of Jasper John’s as far as I’m concerned! Lucky for y’all muh fuckas it’s Sunday, and what a blessed day it is to confess some sins.
What sins are you talking about?
Attempted robbery of a blind man seems like a nice place to start.

EXT. WATERFRONT BEHIND BLIND JASPER’S JUNKYARD - DAY Begin “Swing Low Sweet Chariot” <Jasper’s Family Choir> Blind Jasper John is dressed in all white and stands wais deep in water holding a bible; he has the pistol tucked i his pants.  50. Zak and Tyler sit on an old tire and watch on. Jasper’s family is in attendance. Three small African American children all under the age of 5, with their Mother (32) a Grand Mother (64). Tyler looks slightly uncomfortable, but bears with it.

There are wolves in this world and there are sheep. I might not has my eyes, but I know the difference. And I knows that both you boys are just two weary fleece wearing travelers who have lost y’alls way. Neither of y’all is wolves. Y'all just sheep who have strayed from His flock. Jasper looks to the sky, Tyler swallows hard.

I’m donatin’ supplies from my junk yard for your pilgrimage, anything but that tin boat you can has it. Cause I sees it as my duty to get both you sheep back to your Shepard. Tyler and Zak look slightly relieved.

I cain’t has you boys runnin off from here with dirt on y’alls hands. A wolf can hunt you down just by the smell of the sins of yo’ past. I don’t want no wolves getting a’hold of you now, cause that would be a frightful bloody mess. (beat) So we gonna clean you up right. (beat) With a baptism.
(to Tyler) What is that?
It’s like swimming. Zak looks intrigued.  51.
Both y’all come down here and bathe in the warm waters of forgiveness. Zak limps to the water's edge; he cautiously steps in.

(to Zak) Today marks the first day of the rest of your life. Nothing can touch you with the good grace of the Lord. (to Tyler) Stand up son, accept His blessing. (beat) Put the wolves of yo’ past to rest. Blind Jasper John’s family all watch in silence.
I’m more of a baptism by fire kind of guy.

Well, unfortunately I don’t perform those kinds of baptisms. Begin flashback music. cur TO: Zak, arms spread wide, falls backwards in the brown murky river. Blind Jasper John is there to catch him, and holds nose as he slips under the water.
--Tyler aggressively collects things around the junkyard Zak helps. Barrels / rope / wood pallets / old bed sheets Tyler's shotgun is peacefully framed in the foreground.
--Tyler ties the barrels to scraps of wood and then start hammering nails. Close-up on the shotgun where “FAMILY FIRST” is branded.

--He takes a dirty sheet and makes a crude sail out of it --Tyler and Zak are building a raft.  52. --They throw extra wood on the platform and then push the raft into the water. Tyler carefully pins the photo of Mark and himself to the crude steering mechanism at the back of the raft. EXT. WATERFRONT BEHIND BLIND JASPER’S JUNKYARD - DAY --Tyler and Zak push the raft along two small pine trees, with their bark shaved off, into the water with a splash. --It looks like trash, but it floats and they look please --Blind Jasper John shakes Tyler’s hand.
OK then, Moses. Fade out flashback music.

location: RAFT FLOATING DOWN A CREEK WITH CEDARS

text: Tyler sits on the front of the raft with his feet hanging over the edge. His shotgun is resting in his lap. Zak sits next to him, noticing his somber mood. Tyler stares into the silky almost black water. The two sit in silence for a long time. Zak puts his arm around Tyler.
Tyler, when I can take care of you, I will. Tyler lets this settle in.
I will give you all the wishes for my birthday.
Begin flashback music.
Rain pours down as Mark and Tyler sit side by side with t legs hanging off the end of a boat dock. They laugh and have a conversation but no words can be he End flashback music.
Thank you.
You’re welcome. Tyler begins to break down and caves into Zak’s embrace.
Eleanor knocks on Jasper’s front door. He answers she holds up a photo of Zak.
Excuse me sir, I was wondering if you've seen--
I ain’t seen shit, girl! Eleanor notices the cataracts in Jasper’s eyes.
Well, maybe you might have heard... Eleanor is searching for the words.
You God fearing? Eleanor looks confused.
Tyler hops off the raft followed by Zak, who winces in pa when he steps down in the sand.
Ouch, my ankle!  54.
You hurt your ankle? Tyler takes a sip of whiskey from the dirty brown jug the hands it to Zak.
Here, this’1l numb it down. Zak takes the liquor and chugs. Tyler watches and nods his head in approval. Zak smiles at Tyler and hands him back the whiskey.
Tyler matches Zak’s chug, gulp for gulp.

Zak has his shirt off, he is doing jumping jacks in the s beside a bonfire. The jug of whiskey, noticeably lighter than before, rests near by. Tyler counts reps from a reclined position across the fir
Zak stops doing push-ups, tired now from the effort.
I definitely can not feel my ankle anymore! Or my legs! Or my head! Zak raises his hands in the air.
Tyler laughs. Zak swigs the whiskey, then stands and tries to lift a la piece of driftwood laying nearby. He can’t do it.
I’m not strong enough.
Who is strong enough?  55. Zak looks confused.
Don’t you need, like another name. An alter ego? The Salt Water Redneck wasn’t born with that name.
Are you sure that wasn’t his name when he was born?
Nah, I bet his name was Frank or Beau or something. (beat) If you can’t do it, then who can? Zak thinks on this.
Tyler gets up and walks into the darkness. He comes back with two large branches filled with leaves. He attaches the branches with duct tape to the back of Za body like wings.
OK. Let’s see it Falcon. Zak tries to lift the driftwood and gets it a little high but fails again. He drops the wood.

War paint. Zak nods in approval. Tyler grabs some charcoal from around the fire and rubs i Zak's face in four even lines like a warrior football pla Zak smiles. Zak dips his hand in the jar of peanut butter and smears handful on his face to complement the charcoal lines.
The Peanut Butter Falcon. Tyler smiles.  56.
The Peanut Butter Falcon.

Tyler and Zak both have war paint on their faces. Zak stands only in his underwear and Peanut Butter Falcon regalia, struggling to get the driftwood lifted. His face is veiny, red, and sweaty, reflecting the fireli Zak yells like a warrior in the throws of battle. Tyler looks on excited and nervous at the same time.

--Zak flips the driftwood into the air and onto the fire sending sparks high into the night sky. --Tyler rips his shirt off and starts screaming at the to his lungs. --Zak flexes his muscles and starts jumping up and down. --They run around the inferno yelling like wild savages. --Zak moves his arms like falcon wings and howls at the m --They do a tribal dance as they spin around the blaze. --The flames rage high into the night sky.
Zak and Tyler are both passed out on the sand. The fire from the night before smolders. Zak snores soundly, his mouth agape.
A van drives down a dirt road toward the thick black trai smoke in the distance.  57.

A van arrives, tires on gravel; a door opens and closes, followed by the chirping sound of a car lock engaging. Footsteps approach, a purse drops onto the ground beside keys on a “Britthaven Retirement” keychain jingle inside. A hand wipes peanut butter off of Zak's face. Eleanor is crouching over him, she looks relieved.
Oh Zak, thank God you’re okay. Zak begins to stir and sits up, hungover. Tyler stands fifty yards away peeing into the bay.
(to Tyler) Haven't seen him, huh? Tyler smiles wryly and yells in a low, mocking voice.
ELEANOR! I FOUND HIM, HE’S RIGHT
Is that funny to you? You think this is a game? (to Zak) Get up Zak; we are leaving.
He’s not going anywhere. Zak, stay put.
I had to drive for twelve miles down a dirt road to find you, twelve miles and my cell phone battery is dead now! What if there was an emergency? What if he got hurt?
He did get hurt.
(to Zak) Are you hurt?!  58.
My ankle hurts.
Exactly my point! (to Tyler) You've got a boy with Down syndrome out here in the middle of nowhere, doing God knows what!
He’s not a child, he’s damn near twenty-two years old!
He needs someone to take care of him! Who are you anyway!?
I’m the guy taking care of him because you can’t do it without keeping him in a cage.
That’s cute. So you two are in some sort of primitive gang?! This isn’t Lord of The Flies! There are rules and regulations and red tape and paperwork--
While you were talking about eventually doing some paperwork we were doing a little thing called living.

Living?! You call this living!? You two look like cave men! Tyler and Zak look at each other and take in their bodies unkempt, stinky, dirty, half naked, covered in peanut but and soot. They both grin.
I know. It’s awesome.
It really is awesome, Eleanor.
Get up, Zak! Zak starts to stand up.  59.
Stay where you’re at, Zak! Zak sits down.
(to Eleanor) Can I talk to you in private for a moment? Tyler grabs Eleanor’s arm and walks her away from where Z is sitting.
I should have you arrested for kidnapping!
You can’t kidnap someone who ran away, genius.
This isn’t some--
What do you want for Zak?
I’m not going to sell him to you!
No, what do you WANT FOR Zak? For his life.
I’m taking Zak with me.
No you’re not. (beat) Do you know about the wrestling thing?
How do you think I found you?

I made him a promise to get him to that wrestling school, and I don’t break my promises. I see you care about Zak, so I’1l do you a favor. You can ride on the raft with us, that way you can watch out for him. (MORE )
I'm getting him to that wrestling school with or without you. What happens after that... well, that’s your business.
No. I have to go back to work. I’ve got my hours to account for, I can’t just get on your little raft and disappear.
I’m not asking you. At the campfire, Zak takes the keys out of Eleanor’s purs
Hey, Eleanor! Eleanor and Tyler both turn toward Zak as he throws her k far into the deep murky water. There is a comically long pause as Tyler and Eleanor watc Zak in disbelief.
I don’t want to go back. (beat) I’m going to meet the Salt Water Redneck! Eleanor turns back to Tyler and continues to negotiate ev though she has no other options.
That's it. That’s all you get. The wrestling school and that’s the end for you.
It’s not for me. Eleanor looks to Zak who is doing a celebratory dance, an softens.
After that I take him back with me and this becomes a memory.
Whatever, but till then, you give me all of him.  61.
(hesitant) OK. (beat) He goes home with me in the end. They shake hands.
Eleanor sits on the raft, arms crossed, looking unhappy. quiet and tense and the sheet they use for a sail is not catching any wind. Zak stands up and starts blowing into the sail.
How far is it on the raft?
On the map, it’s about this far. (pinches his fingers)
Is that one day?
Well... tide and wind matter, a day or, you know, two.
Zak, why don’t you sit down, you'll get dizzy breathing that hard, and slip and hurt yourself. Tyler shakes his head, frustrated by Eleanor. Zak sits.
Are you hungry, Zak? Did you have breakfast?
I’m not really hungry.
OK, well, maybe you should just have a bite of something--
Don’t do that.  62.
I'm sorry? Tyler thinks.
(to Zak) Eleanor’s right, we should work on your breath control. Just cause we're on a raft doesn’t mean we can’t train, right?
Oh Tyler, that is very smart.
Lean over the edge of the raft and put your head under water. I’11l time you.
(to Eleanor) He CAN stand up on a raft, he CAN feed himself, and he CAN hold his breath while he’s training to be a wrestler.
Yes I can! Tyler nods to Zak and Zak nods back. Zak places his head underwater, unable to hear the conversation that continues above.
Stop calling Zak a retard.
I have never used that word in my life.
Might as well have, they way you treat him. You--

Zak's head is underwater, his eyes are open wide and his cheeks are puffed as he holds his breath. The voices above on the raft are muted by the sound of bubbles and chop lapping against the makeshift boat’s hul
The nerve you must have to even think--
People that call Zak a retard are only saying that he can’t do something they can. So you might not be saying the word retard but you're sure as shit making him feel retarded.
Are you kidding me?
No. I’m not kidding you. You’re just as bad as they are. You make him think he is completely incapable of doing anything on his own. Zak comes up, gasps for air and interrupts them.
Time!
Nice work dude!
How long was that?
Pretty long.
Not long enough. Do it again,
Zak slams his face back into the water. Zak.  64.

Do you even know what I do? I’ve spent the last two years of my life volunteering to hold widows’ hands as they slip from this world to the next. I’m the one they look at when they take their last breath--
Zak holds his breath and surveys the water below. His eyes open wider as a large fish swims close.
Eleanor speaks with more conviction, she and Tyler are po opposites but share a common goal, Zak’s best interests.

Don’t pretend because you took Zak on a camping trip for a night or two that you know anything about my life. I didn't ask for Zak to be placed in a retirement community. I didn’t choose that for him. But that’s what happened, and now I’m doing what needs to be done. Tyler's frustration turns to admiration for Eleanor’s passion. He is beginning to understand her point of view. Zak explodes out of the water holding large fish by the gills.
Tyler, Eleanor, and Zak all sit in a circle around the fi roasting on a ramshackle spit over a small burn barrel.
Three options today for lunch.
Three options! Yeah! Eleanor, warmer than before, looks like she is enjoying t because Zak is so happy.  65.
Option one. Hot water we boil from the sound.
BLECK! I don’t want to drink more sound water, Tyler!
Option two is plain fish.
You know what I want, Tyler. Eleanor smiles at how much fun Zak is having.
Option three is...FISH with PEANUT
FISH and peanut butter!! I want to eat the fish with the peanut butter!
(to Eleanor) We gotta give the guy what he wants!

Yes you do! Tyler tears the fish apart with his bare hands and passes chunk to Zak who already had a handful of peanut butter ready. He rubs the peanut butter all over the flaky white meat and immediately starts eating. Tyler then rips off another piece and hands it to Eleanor.
Try to eat around the bones. Tyler digs in. Eleanor looks at her handful of hot fish scrap and eats.
Good, huh?
I wouldn't say it’s gourmet... Tyler and Zak look at her, slightly offended.  66.
But you boys did great. Eleanor smiles at Tyler, acknowledging his efforts. Zak does his secret handshake with Tyler as Eleanor watch
What is that?
It’s a secret handshake we do when stuff is really awesome.
It’s what we do to celebrate.
Yeah, we did it when I almost got ran over by that big boat.
That boat was a close one. Eleanor swallows hard.
And we did it when someone shot a gun at us but we didn’t get any bullet holes in our bodies.
(under her breath) Oh God. Tyler winks at Eleanor, and gives a warm smile.

Tyler turns the crank on his radio. A bluegrass song abou summer comes on. Tyler and Zak take turns jumping off of a rope swing that hangs from the hook of a crane stored temporarily in the reeds. Tyler teaches Zak to hold on to the rope tight and Eleano watches, impressed with how much Zak is learning and by h much fun they are having.  67. Tyler flips through the air followed by Zak doing a karat kick.
Tyler and Zak sit on a barge, playfully calling to Eleano she stands on a stack of pallets getting ready to go off rope swing.
It’s so easy, you just jump, and hold on, and then you let go. (beat) Hold on. Let go.
The rope does all the work, you just enjoy the ride.
OK! OK! I’m going. Stop rushing me.
On the count of three, OK? TYLER (CONT’D) ZAK One! Two! Three-- One! Two! Three--

I’m going! Eleanor takes a deep breath, lets go and swings. She releases the rope and hoots joyfully as she falls int the water. Tyler and Zak match her energy, throwing their arms in th air to celebrate.
Tyler, Eleanor, and Zak sail their raft through open wate Light from the late afternoon sun reflects off the surfac
Duncan and Ratboy stand at the camp fire Zak and Tyler da around the night before. Ratboy is trying on Zak’s makeshift falcon wings. Duncan picks up the empty peanut butter jar and smells it

Eleanor and Zak slow dance on the raft as it floats slowl down a glassy creek lined with 1,000 year old cedars. The fire in the small burn barrel beside them casts flickering light on the knotted stumps and twisted branch of the trees that surround them. Tyler watches happily, using a 12 foot push-pole to guide them forward through the water. His movements are fluid a smooth, and the raft glides along almost effortlessly. The energy between the three of them has fully shifted, Eleanor is now a part of the team. For the first time she doing what she thinks is right and not what she’s been to to do. Eleanor places Zak’s hand on her hip as they move.
Good. That’s it. (beat) How does your ankle feel?
Ummm...it is really great now Eleanor, thank you. Zak looks down at his feet. He counts with her.
One. Two. Three. One. Two. One. Two. Three. One. Two. Three. Three. The sun sets behind them.
Look into my eyes.
But, I need to look at my feet.  69.
No you don’t. You can do it. Zak and Eleanor look into each others eyes as she counts.
One. Two. Three. Good Zak, good. Zak smiles wide.
This is a good story that we will tell.
Yes it is.
I like when we are all together.
One man’s voice hushes another. The sound of liquid being poured in the darkness. A match is struck.

Tyler, Eleanor, and Zak sleep peacefully on the dusty flo of a room filled with duck calls and decoys. Tyler's sleeping face is abruptly illuminated by a harsh flickering light. The raft is on fire! Tyler wakes up and runs toward the shore.
Tyler looks at the burning raft in disbelief, powerless. Duncan enters the frame.
We've been looking for you. A gun cocks.  70. Ratboy stands 10 feet to the side of Tyler, holding a pis aimed in his direction. Tyler puts his hands in the air.

Get on your knees. Tyler lowers to his knees. Zak peeks out fearfully from the hunting cabin window, th burning raft illuminates his face. Eleanor is still aslee behind him. Duncan stares at Tyler; and then leans in closer.

That’s twelve thousand dollars of gear that’s burnt up. You know how many hours I’m gonna spend braiding wire. I got mouths to feed. (beat) What’s gonna stop people from thinking they can cut the buoys off our pots now that you've done it? Or burn our gear up? (beat) Them Vietnamese are looking for an excuse to start pulling pots again, and you know how that got handled. Tyler listens.
I’m glad it wasn’t me that had to put that hammer down, but someone did. And it’s better now. Ratboy squirms with pride and discomfort.

Cops aren’t gonna do anything and you know it. A few month's probation and that’s it? Nah, you gotta get what’s coming to you; not revenge for revenge sake, but for the rest of us, for our livelihood. (beat) If no one else is gonna do this then I see it as my job to get done. Duncan nods at Ratboy who nods back.  71.

Duncan-— BANG! A gun shot goes off. Duncan looks startled as Zak, holding Tyler’s shotgun, st out from the cabin door. Zak points the weapon directly at Ratboy who is still pointing his pistol at Tyler. Eleanor, emerges behind Zak. She looks startled, not know what is going on or who these men are.
(to Tyler) I didn’t know you were traveling with friends. (to Zak) You the brains of this outfit? Zak's shotgun wobbles a bit, but he stands firm.
(to Zak) You can pull that trigger, but can you aim that thing? Duncan starts to make a move toward Zak. Zak widens his stance.
(to Ratboy) It’s buckshot. This stops Duncan’s forward momentum. Ratboy looks to Dun Duncan motions for him to put the pistol on the ground. Tyler stands and backs up a few paces.
(to Zak) What’s the play then bud? Zak pumps his shotgun. Eleanor takes control and places her hand on Zak’s should
You don’t want to spend the rest of your life in a jail cell.  72.
(to Duncan) You're going to get in your boat and you’re gonna leave. I won't come back to Colington, you'll never see me again, and we call it even on the crab pots. The fishing license is yours.
It already is mine. Tyler makes eye contact with Zak.
(to Duncan) Then we do it different. Zak ignores Eleanor’s pleas and raises the shotgun higher with bravado.
(to Zak) I guess you’re the boss.

I guess I am. Duncan and Ratboy slowly retreat toward their boat as Zak keeps them in his crosshairs. They start the engines and drive off. Once the boat is out of sight, Eleanor runs over and thro Ratboy’s handgun into the water.
Tyler, Zak, and Eleanor walk silently down the beach thre abreast still shaken from the standoff with Duncan and Ratboy.

The Ayden pier sits dormant, the town is still asleep. Ty reaches under a control panel and rubs two wires together sparks fly and the Ferris wheel comes to life. All three are illuminated by the colorful lights.  73.
(to Tyler) Is that why you’re out here? Were you running from them? Tyler nods.
Do you think they’1l come back for you? Tyler thinks as he activates the motor. The wheel starts rotating.
No...I think it’s over.
All three sit close in the car at the top of the Ferris w and watch the sun climb out from behind the ocean. The first light of the day breaks on their faces. Eleanor rests her head on Zak.

When I was a kid, my mom used to let me keep all of her change. She got me a piggy bank that looked like a soccer ball. I kept a record of how much I had in there. I had this little notebook in my bedside drawer so I could record it, with the date next to it and everything.
What were you saving up for?
No idea, nothing, just saving. I just did it to make her happy.
How much did you have?
Almost four hundred dollars.
(smiles) That’s more than I have right now.  74.
Yeah...our house burned down.
No!
Yeah. Everything was fine; we got the dogs out, thank God. But we lost all our family photos and keepsakes.
Did you get the piggy bank?
Nope.
Shoulda spent that money.

Yeah. (beat) I’m not used to this, just living in this moment right now. Not planning, not worried about the past or the future. Just right now. It feels really nice. The horizon turns from pale pink to a bright orange.
All three exit the Ferris wheel.
Give me just a minute.
Tyler stands alone knee deep in the water. Eleanor and Za chat softly in the distance. Tyler gently lays the shotgu into the water with both hands; he is content. He turns back to join them.
Eleanor, sitting in a booth by the window, plugs her cell phone into a wall charger.  75. The phone turns on.
Yes Glen, I’ve got him with me right now. She looks through the glass at Zak and Tyler, who practic Tai Chi in the parking lot.
No, he’s OK. Some sunburn and a couple scrapes but nothing’s broken. She watches Tyler as he and Zak do their secret handshake

No, he was completely alone. (beat) No don’t send anyone, I can handle it. (beat) I’m thinking tomorrow some time later in the day, I’ve got to call a locksmith, and I’ve got some loose ends to tie up, so can you transfer me to Janice, we need to have clean sheets put on Zak’s bed. (beat) What? No. Yeah I labeled hima flight risk but-- (beat) Glen, I can handle him from here on, I just-- (beat) Cherry Hill is a mental health facility with drug addicts and prostitutes, you can’t just put Zak in a place like that and expect-- (beat) No, you're right, that’s not my job. I just think Zak would be better suited-- (under her breath) Why are you doing this? (beat) Nothing...OK, schedule his processing for later tomorrow then. Eleanor hangs the phone up and gently hits her head again the glass window.  76. A WAITRESS (62), approaches the table.
Is there anything I can get for you hunny? Eleanor looks defeated, but recomposes.
Have you heard of the Salt Water Redneck?
Everybody knows Salt Water, he used to be a celebrity.
I need his address. EXT. PARKING LOT.
I am going to walk right up to him and say “I am here to learn the wrestling moves! SO TEACH ME! BOOYAH!”

EXT. SALT WATER REDNECK’S TRAILER - DAY Tyler knocks on the door of a dilapidated trailer. Thirty feet away, Zak stands hidden behind Eleanor, just of earshot; he is unexpectedly shy. Long pause. Tyler knocks again.
Maybe this is the wrong house. Tyler looks at a piece of paper with the address on it in Eleanor’s handwriting.

No. This is it. Finally... The door opens and a much older and tired look Salt Water Redneck, without makeup or long hair, steps in the light.  77. He is a shadow of what he once was, almost unrecognizable
Who are you?
Are you The Salt Water Redneck? He notices Zak.
What is this?
I'm sorry, is this is the wrestling school?
Who's askin?
My name’s Tyler; I ain’t selling nothin’ to you. You see that guy back there?
Yeah. Tyler swallows and holds back tears.

Well, we done some hard traveling to get to you. It’s a big deal seein’ you here. You mind just waving to him? (beat) He’s got a lot riding on this you mind just waving to him? Salt Water looks beyond Tyler to Zak hiding behind Eleano
How ya doing? The Salt Water Redneck awkwardly lifts his hand and waves Zak waves back.
Hey.  78.
You don’t teach no wrestling school here no more?
I closed that about ten years ago.

Did you? (beat) So I promised him he could do this one thing. This wrestling thing. And he told me about this school here in Ayden. (beat) Now I gotta break his heart. (beat) And I don’t really know what to say to him. (beat) What’s your name?
Clint. They shake hands.
Nice to meet you.
So... He used to be a fan?
Oh, more than that. Shit, you're his hero. (beat) He believes in you... That’s a hard thing to do, believe in something. Zak watches on. He can’t hear what they are saying.
(calling to Zak) Zak. This is Clint. Zak pokes his head out from behind Eleanor.
(to Salt Water Redneck) You mind if he comes up here and says hi?  79.
That'd be alright.
(to Zak) Come on up here. Zak walks to join Tyler at the door.

Hey pal The Salt Water Redneck don’t live here no more. (beat) Clint is just a regular guy like me or you and he wanted to shake your hand. Zak wears his disappointment on his face and reaches out shake Clint’s hand.
How you doing?
Good, nice to meet you.
Alright bud, let’s go...
Tyler, Zak, and Eleanor all walk in silence.
Tyler? Tyler just listens, somber.
I bet we could find him, if we all go look for him together on a raft. (beat) The three of us could find him, Tyler. You, me and Eleanor can find him. I bet he’s hiding out ina swamp.
(softly) Zak, The Salt Water Redneck isn’t real; he doesn’t exist.  80.
Yes he does. I have the videotape. I have seen him.
Zak, It’s over now, you’re coming back with me.

But you told me I could do it, Tyler. You promised me that a strong person like me could do it. (beat) Let’s not go back. We can take care of each other. We can be a family. I can catch the fish. I’1l be the hero always for you guys. (beat) I can take care of you.
We have lives we have to get back to.
Is your life better than this? Eleanor truly considers this question.
Is your life better than this right now? Is your life better than the raft we made? It’s not and you know it! We love each other! You love each other, and I love you! (beat) It’s simple.
It’s not simple. Zak lets this sink in.
Zak, I can’t--

You won’t. You can. You just won’t. Long pause. An old, beat-up and rusty Pontiac Firebird complete with flame engulfed phoenix decal on the hood comes speeding u the road from behind them.  81. The horn plays Dixie and the engine roars as it comes to screeching halt, spraying dust. Zak looks at the fiery bird on the hood as the dust settl The Salt Water Redneck adjusts his blonde wig and bandana he gets out of the driver’s seat. His makeup job looks rushed, he wears blue camouflage briefs and knee-high wrestling boots.
(to himself) I knew it.
I heard that there was a Salt Water Redneck fan here that came to enroll in the wrestling school. Zak smiles from ear to ear.
Yeah. The Salt Water Redneck walks over to Zak and extends his hand.
My name is Clint, but my friends call me The Salt Water Redneck. (beat) I would like it if you called me The Salt Water Redneck.
Redneck... Zak takes a deep breath and kneels before Salt Water.

I am here to learn the wrestling moves! Please teach me your ways, oh powerful one! I will do the best I can for you. I will make you proud, Salt Water Redneck. Salt Water looks pleased with his redemption.

Teach me to throw.  82. EXT. WRESTLING RING - SALT WATER’S FRONT YARD - DUSK Salt Water enthusiastically teaches Zak wrestling moves i homemade ring comprised of ropes strung between a few sho stuck in the ground and a lawn mower handle. Salt Water briefly introduces Zak to his roommate, SAM (5 an intimidatingly large man who sports a mullet haircut a wears a faded work-issued, pest-control shirt. Sam watches intently beside the ring with his arms crosse He enjoys watching the two wrestle, but for different reasons. Salt Water feels good to be back in the makeshift setup. He has fun with Zak as he shows off. Salt Water teaches Zak to stomp his foot when he pretends hit someone. Sam watches with focus but doesn't say much. Salt Water rolls on the ground showing Zak how to properl take a fall.
Ummm... What about the “Atomic throw?”

Oh. (beat) We made that move up just for the videos. It was smoke and mirrors, you know, it was just a camera on my face so it looked like I was holding someone over my head. It’s not possible. See, try to pick me up. Zak tries to pick up Salt Water, but his weight is too mu He stops and sighs. Salt Water notices Zak getting upset. SALT WATER REDNECK (CONT’D) My manager thought a gimmick might sell more mercy. The “Atomic Throw” was just a publicity stunt. Zak looks disappointed.  83. Salt Water takes a deep breath. Back to reality. SALT WATER REDNECK (CONT’D) Now grab the back of my neck like this and pull me toward you. Tyler and Eleanor watch Zak and Salt Water from an old co that looks as if it has been sitting outside for years.
Where are you going?
Huh?
After today, after all this, where are you headed? Tyler smiles at the thought of the future prospect.

Florida. (beat) A fresh start. I’m gonna get my own boat and run charters. Take people sport fishing. Make a few bucks while living the good life. It’s gonna be great. (playfully) If you don’t have any plans you can come with me. Eleanor flashes Tyler a look: “Yeah right.” EXT. SALT WATER REDNECK’S TRAILER - NIGHT - LATER Salt Water, Zak, Eleanor, Tyler, and Sam all sit at a pic table, eating boiled corn and hamburger helper off paper plates. Christmas lights, casually strung, help set the m

It takes years to learn certain things, like how to take a fall. You get better with time. If you just apply that stuff in a match, change it up here and there, try not to do the same move twice or whatever, you’re pretty good to go.
OK, yeah? OK.  84.
Alright, let's try it for real. Sam takes notice of what Salt Water is saying.
Try it for real?
Yeah, let’s get you in a ring. Not just practicing moves here with me. I'm talking about a backyard brawl, a real match with real moves.
I don’t know if he’s ready--
Yeah, that seems a bit fast--
(to Eleanor) It’s not like he’s got all the time in the world.
I want to do the wrestling match.
Sink or swim as far as I see it. Let’s do it tomorrow in Jacob's backyard. (to Sam) You're on the bill, right?
(begrudgingly) Yeah.
Great, you two can fight.

Salt Water drives; Zak rides shotgun. Eleanor and Tyler a squeezed into the back with Sam uncomfortably wedged betw them. Salt Water wears normal clothing, his hair blows in wind; Zak doesn’t look nearly as confident. Pink fuzzy handcuffs dangle from the rear view mirror. Everything is quiet.  85. Salt Water stiffens his grip on the steering wheel and abruptly starts screaming at the top of his lungs. Zak is taken by surprise. Salt Water starts slapping Zak’s chest with the back of h hand like a football coach might do to hype up his star quarterback. Eleanor and Tyler lean forward and share confused glances around Sam's gigantic body. Finally, Zak joins in with the screaming. Tyler is next to follow suit, he reaches across Sam, and grabs Eleanor’s hand, and she joins in as well. All except Sam ride in the Firebird screaming at the top their lungs like wild animals. Sam sits stoic and silent, unaffected by the energy of the others.

Samson(Sam’s wrestling alter ego) stands on top of an eig foot ladder in the center of the wrestling ring. He is covered in blood holding a bat wrapped with barb wire. A small crowd of people drink beer and hoot for the show. The words “JACOB'S INFERNO” sit above a barn door that is painted entirely in red, orange, and yellow flames. A broken-down school bus separates the tattered bleachers from the parking lot. Samson howls into the air and does a front flip landing e feet below onto a table where his opponent lies. The table splits in half. Both men hit the ground with a thud. Ribs crack and Zak’s eyes widen. Samson digs his fingers into the eyes of his opponent, wh writhes in pain dramatically. Samson is circling the ring holding a gold belt above his head.  86. In the crowd, Craig (the unforgettably obese character fr the fish docks), laughs obnoxiously at the violence.
