Tyler stiffens at the unmistakable sound of Craig’s laugh the two lock eyes. Zak looks nervous as he watches Samson; he is not prepare for this. Salt Water stands on the other side of the ring being gre warmly by JACOB(48), the events emcee and referee who hol bullhorn. Jacob is a gruff showman who is missing a tooth started The Inferno just for the love of wrestling. Salt Water points toward Zak, and Jacob looks across the chaos to size him up. Jacob shakes his head no. Zak swallows nervously. Salt Water looks like he is pleading his case. Finally, J nods, then shakes hands with Salt Water. Salt Water hands him a small piece of paper. Craig pushes through the crowd and opens a phone as he ex

(into the bullhorn) We are going to have a special exhibition here for you shortly folks. The Tidewater’s very own Salt Water Redneck has brought with him a wrestling protégé. Salt Water comes back over to where Zak, Eleanor, and Tyl are standing.

Alright! We’re good to go! Had to do a little convincing but I greased the wheels. You’ll fight Sam after this. Sam hits his opponent in the face with a metal chair. Teeth fly. The small crowd cheers wildly. Zak is shaken. Eleanor takes it all in.  87. INT. SALT WATER REDNECK’S FIREBIRD - DAY In the parking lot, Tyler and Eleanor speak in private in of Salt Water’s Firebird. The sounds of Samson’s wild how grunts, and yells punctuate their conversation.
No.
Clint said Sam is going to go easy on him. It'll be simple, a couple moves and he will lay down and let Zak win.
No. No, this is different Tyler--
You said I could have all of him. A savage howl followed by a shriek causes Eleanor to paus
Not this much.
(beat) OK. Eleanor takes the ‘OK’ as a win, and that Tyler has agree her terms. Tyler moves Eleanor’s hair softly with his hand. (Alternate) Tyler kisses Eleanor.

What are you doing? With the fuzzy pink handcuffs that were dangling from the mirror, Tyler uses slight of hand to lock Eleanor to the Firebird’s steering wheel. As he exits, he looks back and smiles.
No one is going to die today.

location: BEHIND THE SCENES OF THE MATCH

text: Zak sits in a metal folding chair paying close attention Salt Water coaches.

You have to be aggressive, steer the match where you want it to go. Zak nods his head, not confident. SALT WATER REDNECK (CONT’D) You can talk to Sam, but just keep it small and quiet. Don’t let the audience in too much. Just remember to roll with it, take the punches and then come back harder. As far as your smack talk goes, the moment you get in the ring say the meanest most evil thing you can think of to get in his head and rile the audience up good. (beat) You gotta say the most MANIACAL thing you can possibly think of. Zak looks scared. Tyler approaches, having left Eleanor in the car. SALT WATER REDNECK (CONT’D) If you start to bleed use it to your advantage, play it up. Maybe wipe it all over your face. (beat) OK, I’ll be in the stands watching. Salt Water pats Zak on the shoulder and walks away. As he is leaving, he slaps Tyler on the chest once and excitedly screams in his face. Tyler salutes. Zak sits, still shaken by Salt Water’s words.
Tyler?
No. Don’t you do that. Not now.
I’m scared.
You know you can do this, you've got this. (MORE )
(beat) Say “I’ve got this.”
What?
Say “I’ve got this!” Say it to me.
I’ve got this?
No. Not like you’re asking me if you've got it, say it like you know it’s true. Zak doesn't respond. Tyler grabs him by the collar.
Say it! Say it to me! Make me believe it! (beat) Make me believe. Long pause as they look at each other.
I've got this.
I don’t believe you.
Tyler smiles.
Good. I knew you did. I just needed you to know. (beat) Let’s find something to dress you in. curt TO:
Craig speaks into his flip phone.  90.
Nah, man I’m telling you he’s here. (beat) Yeah, I saw him plain as day!
Ratboy watches Duncan who is lost in thought.
Whatcha gonna do? Duncan takes off his hat and tosses it aside with purpose

Jacob stands in the middle of the ring on top of a chair speaking into his bullhorn. He is being circled by Samson, sweaty, still holding the barbed wire bat and wearing the gold belt. Zak stands in the darkness, just beyond the stage.
We were going to pack it up and head home having already crowned a champion for today. The crowd cheers fueling Samson’s rage.
But then, at the very last second, an old friend showed up. Salt Water stands up among the crowd and raises his arms. crowd claps.

The Salt Water Redneck has with him today a protégé. Someone new to the world of backyard brawling. Someone who was groomed in a different kind of wrestling mentality. INT. SALT WATER REDNECK’S FIREBIRD - DAY Eleanor rifles through the glove box.  91.

Someone who maybe isn’t cut out for this kind of thing!? Not cut out for this kind of grit! Eleanor finds an old screw driver and tries to jam it int the keyhole of the handcuffs. The crowd boos, and Eleanor moves with more urgency.

A different kind of hero perhaps? I asked Samson, I asked him if he would take this last minute fight and he didn’t want to. He said it wasn’t worth his time. Samson hits his chest hard like a wild animal.
But then I told Samson that not only did this newcomer call hima coward...but he called him weak, and a liar! The crowd boos. Zak looks on from the darkness.
(to himself) I did not say that.
I’m going to eat him alive!
He said that Samson is a liar and doesn’t deserve that belt because he’s not the best. He said that Samson deserves nothing but to lick the dirt off his boots! The crowd boos.
Lets hear it for... He takes out the scrap piece of paper Salt Water gave him earlier and reads it aloud.  92.

The fiery painted doors to the barn slide open to reveal he steps out wearing a handmade Falcon costume made of ca board, duct tape, sticks, and strips of fabric. He looks magnificent. The roaring crowd goes silent, as Zak stands looking arou at everyone. Salt Water looks on from the stands with pride. Tyler, already in Zak's corner, watches Zak from the side the ring with a towel draped over his shoulder. Zak waves to everyone and smiles. People, not knowing what to do, stiffly wave back. Zak breaks the tension and goes into a flexing routine. He roars loudly. The crowd loses it and starts cheering for Zak as he make his way into the ring with a splendid display of dance mo and flexing poses. The crowd is going ape shit. Everyone is on Zak’s side.

Zak's body flies through the air. He hits the mat hard. The crowd winces in pain. Samson roars. Zak tries to get up. Samson grabs Zak’s leg just as he is about to stand, flip him over, then leg drops on top of Zak, making the ring s violently. Tyler is starting to show worry on his face.
Get up, Zak! Get up! Zak looks to Tyler.  93. Samson grabs Zak's face and pulls it close to his so no o but Zak can hear his angry whisper.

I’ve been doing this twenty five years. I’ve made this my life. I love this, you can’t just step in the ring and expect me to lay down for you. Sam shoves Zak hard, then pulls him in again, face to fac
I don’t care who you are, or what Clint wants. I’m not running a Make-A-Wish Foundation. Sam slides his arm under Zak’s torso and body slams him h into the mat.
Duncan and Ratboy speed down the road in their camouflage truck, intent on retribution.

Samson throws Zak toward the ropes, and then plants himse in the center of the ring. Zak bounces off the ropes and is slingshotted back toward Samson. Samson dodges Zak’s attempt at a clothesline and laughs.

(so the crowd can hear) You think you can come here and challenge me!? IN MY HOUSE!? Zak lays a slap across Samson’s chest. The crowd musters up a halfhearted cheer. It appears Zak might be making a come back.
Zak slaps Samson as hard as he can.
